intro: Ageratina valerioi, commonly known as the velvetleaf ageratum, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, white to pale blue flowers that are often clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in a fine, velvety texture, giving it its common name. Ageratina valerioi is often found in moist, shaded environments and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
